colorCombinations.name: Link color on white
colorCombinations.recommendation: ⚠️ Caution - Use for large text only (18pt+ or 14pt+ bold)

colorCombinations.name: Link color on light gray
colorCombinations.recommendation: ⚠️ Caution - Use for large text only (18pt+ or 14pt+ bold)

colorCombinations.name: Error alert
colorCombinations.recommendation: ⚠️ Caution - Use for large text only (18pt+ or 14pt+ bold)

colorCombinations.name: Header/Footer links
colorCombinations.recommendation: ⚠️ Caution - Use for large text only (18pt+ or 14pt+ bold)

colorCombinations.name: Muted text on white
colorCombinations.recommendation: ❌ Poor - Does not meet accessibility standards

colorCombinations.name: Muted text on light gray
colorCombinations.recommendation: ❌ Poor - Does not meet accessibility standards

colorBlindnessTests.name: Protanopia (Red-blind)
recommendations: Use text labels in addition to coral red for error states
Provide icons or patterns to supplement color coding
Ensure sufficient contrast with background colors

colorBlindnessTests.name: Deuteranopia (Green-blind)
recommendations: Use text labels in addition to golden yellow for success states
Provide clear messaging that doesn't rely on color alone
Use consistent positioning for different message types

colorBlindnessTests.name: Tritanopia (Blue-blind)
recommendations: Ensure blue links have underlines or other visual indicators
Use sufficient contrast ratios for blue text
Provide hover states that don't rely solely on color change

colorBlindnessTests.name: Monochromacy (Complete color blindness)
colorBlindnessTests.description: Cannot see any colors, only shades of gray
recommendations: Ensure all information is conveyed through text, patterns, or shapes
Use high contrast ratios for all text
Provide clear visual hierarchy through typography and spacing

details: All alert types include descriptive titles
Error states provide specific error messages
Interactive elements have proper ARIA labels
Color coding is supplemented with text and icons
ARIA live regions for dynamic content
Visible focus indicators on all interactive elements
Logical tab order throughout the interface
Alternative keyboard shortcuts for mouse actions

recommendations.issue: 6 color combinations do not meet WCAG AA standards
recommendations.solution: Adjust colors or restrict usage to large text only

recommendations.issue: Color-dependent information may not be accessible to color-blind users
recommendations.solution: Ensure all information is conveyed through multiple channels (text, icons, patterns)
implementation: Add descriptive text to all color-coded elements
Use icons in addition to color for status indicators
Provide pattern or texture alternatives for charts and graphs
Test interface with color blindness simulators

recommendations.issue: Opportunity to improve accessibility beyond minimum requirements
implementation: Add user preference for high contrast mode
Implement dark mode with proper contrast ratios
Add animation controls for users with vestibular disorders

1.4.3.name: Contrast (Minimum)
1.4.3.description: Text and background colors must have a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1 (3:1 for large text)
1.4.3.compliance: Mostly compliant - some combinations require large text usage

1.4.6.name: Contrast (Enhanced)
1.4.6.description: Text and background colors must have a contrast ratio of at least 7:1 (4.5:1 for large text)
1.4.6.compliance: Partially compliant - several combinations meet this standard

1.4.1.name: Use of Color
1.4.1.description: Color is not used as the only visual means of conveying information
1.4.1.compliance: Compliant - all color coding supplemented with text and icons

2.4.7.name: Focus Visible
2.4.7.description: Any keyboard operable user interface has a mode of operation where the keyboard focus indicator is visible
2.4.7.compliance: Compliant - focus indicators implemented for all interactive elements

4.1.3.name: Status Messages
4.1.3.description: Status messages can be programmatically determined through role or properties
4.1.3.compliance: Compliant - ARIA live regions and proper roles implemented
